Disease: Prion diseases, or transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (TSE)
Plague — specifically the septicemic or pneumonic type
Smallpox Variola major — specifically the malignant (flat) or hemorrhagic type
Granulomatous amoebic encephalitis, Balamuthia mandrillaris & Acanthamoeba
Ebola virus disease — specifically EBOV "strain" (formerly Zaire Ebola virus)
Smallpox, Variola major — in pregnant women
Ebola virus disease (for all types of ebolavirus outbreaks combined)
Marburg virus disease - all outbreaks combined
Pertussis (whooping cough), infants, unvaccinated, in developing countries
Pertussis (whooping cough), children, unvaccinated, in developing countries
Hand, foot and mouth disease, children < 5 years old
